data.title: TRIBUTE PAID TO ACTOR HARRY.
data.meta_description: Free Online Library: TRIBUTE PAID TO ACTOR HARRY. by "The Mirror (London, England)";  General interest Actors Appreciation Actresses
data.text:
Byline: MIRROR REPORTER

THE heartbroken son of Northern Ireland actor Harry Towb paid tribute to his father who died at the age of 83.

Mr Towb, born in Larne, Co Antrim, passed away peacefully in his London home on Friday after battling cancer for a short time.

He grew up in Belfast and worked with different theatrical groups before moving to England in the 1950s.

In December he appeared in the TV soap EastEnders.

His son Joshua said: "He loved his family very much. But he never liked not to be working.

Mr Towb appeared in Dr Who and The Seeds Of Death in 1969.

Joshua added: "He worked through his illness as long as he could, until a few months ago."

One of the actor's biggest stage roles was in the National Theatre production of Brighton Beach Memoirs.

In his home town he most recently played Tiresias in Antigone at Belfast's Waterfront Hall.

Elsewhere Mr Towb's numerous television credits include The Avengers, Moll Flanders, Heartbeat, Casualty, and The Bill.

He is survived by his wife, actress Diana Hoddinott, children Emily, Daniel and Joshua, and three granddaughters.

CAPTION(S):

CO-STAR Harry Towb worked with Charlie Brooks in Eastenders TALENTED He appeared in Dr Who, right, in his early days
